page.title: 14CHANGES IN STURTON
page.content: We went to Mr. Barlow's on Tuesday to ask him how the village had changed.He said that the prices were very cheap in fact you couldget bread for half a penny.There used to be lots of shops in Sturton now there are only about two.We found out that the highest building in Sturton was the church but now it's the Power Station.There used to be a Cobbler,a Black smith and a Carpenter.There were no street lights or house lights.There were only oil lamps.The transport was bicycles pony and traps.Buses came in to the village every hour.There was a station.The trains carried passengers and goods.There was one methodist chapel and a sunday school building in Sturton.
